string.text: Pilman
Arkady
Cygnus
Dr.Lyuger
Clear Sky: New Sky
Cold has asked to see me. I can find him in the Clear Sky base.
I've donated some funds to Cold for the new Clear Sky base. Report back to him when seven days are up.
I've donated some funds to Cold for the new Clear Sky base. Report back to him when five days are up.
I've donated some funds to Cold for the new Clear Sky base. Report back to him when two days are up.
Clear Sky plans to build a new base in Jupiter. It is time to see Cold and plan the next move.
I have promised to assist Clear Sky in building the new base. Cold told me to go to Jupiter and talk with the leader there.
Are you looking for me?
Are you looking for me?
Yes. Your recent actions have caught my attention. I'm looking for someone capable like you to help with a new undertaking.
What is it?

We plan to build a new base in Jupiter so that we can more effectively operate in the north. In addition to providing research opportunities, it could open up new sources of revenue to all of us. Naturally, this is an expensive operation and we've never been swimming in cash - one hundred thousand roubles more should get us off the ground. Since you have been so helpful to the interests of Clear Sky recently, would you consider making a significant donation?
That's certainly no small figure. However, I think I can help with half of it. %c[d_orange][50000 RU]
Thank you for your contribution. We'll have to find some other way to gather the rest; with some luck, it should take no more than a week. Come back and see me then.
I can contribute seventy thousand. The rest is up to you. %c[d_orange][70000 RU]
Your assistance is highly appreciated! We just have to gather together the rest of the funds - should take around five days. Why don't you come back then?
Always happy to help Clear Sky. Here's the whole thing. %c[d_orange][100000 RU]
What a magnanimous stalker! We'll have a drink to your generosity! This makes things much more simple for us - we should be able to start in two days. Come see me then.
Sorry. I really can't help you with that.
How's it coming?

The operation is successful. The advance teams have already swept the area and it's now safe and under our control. We would be grateful if you could stop in to see the new base commander; I'm sure there's plenty of things they could use your help with. The new outpost is situated in an old checkpoint south of Yanov station. Once again, thanks for your help - Clear Sky will never forget what you've done here. As a token of our gratitude, please take this rifle. I think you could make more use of it than I can.
Operations are still proceeding; there are still things that have yet to be done. You should come back later.
Who are you? What brings you here?
I came here on Cold's suggestion - he thought you might need an extra hand.
Well then, welcome to our new outpost! Maybe you should get some rest before we talk business.
I'm quite surprised that an outsider is so eager to assist Clear Sky. Why? Knowing Clear Sky's delicate position, I'm sure you can understand why we would be curious to know who our friends are.
My reasons are my own.
I guess I'll just have to accept that. Cold obviously trusts you, and I trust him. I hope you'll be honest with us.
Clear Sky is one of our allies; what is good for you is good for us.
Well, we're always happy to see volunteers. When we're full established here, we'll be happy to repay the kindness to your people.
The Zone is fraught with hostility and animosity. We don't have a chance if we're not looking out for one-another.
Wise words. We may have different ideas about the Zone, but mutual respect is the way to survive.
I'm just here to help. I hope I can earn your trust.
I hope so too. Most enemies around here usually go straight to the shooting, so you've made a good start. It's our policy to ask questions, you understand.
Clear Sky: My Gun Is Yours
Pilman asked me to escort three persons to the new base. Their names are Arkady, Cygnus and Lyuger.
I have escorted Arkady, Cygnus and Lyuger to the new base. Now I need to report to Pilman.
So, what can I do to help?
Seeing that Cold chose you to come here, I'm guessing that he has some plans for you - more than just running around doing busywork. In that case, I think this job is for you.
I am listening.

I have some old friends. In the days under Lebedev we worked together running special assignments for Clear Sky. After the catastrophe with Strelok, we decided to disband. Now times have changed, and I need their help again. I need you to escort them here. Their names are Arkady, Cygnus and Lyuger. I will send their location to your PDA. Just use my name, Pilman, they'll know what it means.
Can you tell me about those men I have to escort?
Sure.
Okay. That is enough.
Tell me about Arkady.

Arkady was a businessman kidnapped by bandits and ended up in the Zone against his will. After we had rescued him from the bandits, he decided to join us. We're all pretty handy with a shooter, but he's good at cutting deals too. He has always negotiated the best prices for us, whether he's selling artefacts or buying weapons at the flea market. Now they've got him doing paperwork at our base in the Great Swamp.
Tell me about Cygnus.

Cygnus is a damn good shooter and is pretty much obsessed with firearms. After leaving, he stuck around at the Skadovsk in Zaton to study gunsmithing from a local technician. I believe it is time to put his skills to use.
Tell me about Lyuger.

Lyuger was a doctor from the outside world, came to the Zone with an Ecologist expedition. He discovered some artifacts that were effective in treating wounds but the Ecologists objected to the experiments he was doing. Seeing his talents go unappreciated, he joined us. You can find him wandering around the north of our base in the Great Swamp looking for artefacts.
Clear Sky: My Gun Is Yours
I have to escort Arkady to the new base in Jupiter. Currently, he is staying at the Clear Sky base in the the Great Swamp.
Huh? What is it?
Oh, nothing.
Pilman needs your help.

Ah yes, I heard about that. He told me that he wants me to head up to the new site in Jupiter after his guys are done setting everything up. To be honest, I was getting a little bored with this busywork.
He told me to escort you.

That's just like him: he thinks that I can't get myself up there without his help. Hey, just because I know how to use my head doesn't mean I can't handle a shooter. You can leave now, I'll head out after I pack my belongings.
Clear Sky: My Gun Is Yours
I have to escort Cygnus to the new base in Jupiter. Currently, he stuck around at the Skadovsk in Zaton.
What's up, man?
Ha, Pilman will want to see what I'm working on.
Pilman needs your help.
Pilman, eh? So I guess the rumor about the new base in Jupiter is true. Interesting. Well, thanks for letting me know. I'll make my way there pretty soon.
He told me to escort you.

That's alright, I can handle it myself - haven't forgotten how to shoot a gun just yet. However, I've had a drink or two and it isn't a good idea to travel like that. Tell him... I'll get up there as soon as I can.
Clear Sky: My Gun Is Yours
I have to escort Lyuger to the new base in Jupiter. I can find him wandering around the notrh of the Clear Sky base in the the Great Swamp.
I agreed to help Lyuger finding a Soul artefact hiding between those gas anomalies nearby.
I had found the Soul artefact as Lyuger mentioned but I lost it. Now, I have to find another one in replacement.
I had found the Soul artefact as Lyuger mentioned. Now I need to bring it to him.
Yes?
Hm, Pilman. That never bodes well.
Pilman needs your help.

I bet he does. Very well. It's just that... according to my model, this anomaly field should have certainly created a Soul artefact today. It is very important for my research that I obtain it. But the damn detector... it isn't working properly.
I know a thing or two about finding artefacts. I can get it for you.
You? Okay, but use caution. One step in a gas anomaly and your leg will have to be amputated - I've done it before.
Here. %c[d_orange][Soul]

On second thought, you just keep it. Clear Sky is about fair rewards for good work, not contracting Mercenary scumbags for suicide missions. It would just be a waste if we left it here, wouldn't it? So, the old Checkpoint in Jupiter, right? He's already told me about the situation. Okay, I will see you there.
He wanted me to escort you.
If you want to escort some useless egghead, then go see those lazy-ass Ecologists in Yantar. I can make my own way.
The team is back together.

Thank you stalker. Thought they might have wanted to come without a guide - they're stubborn like that. Still, thought I'd offer it... If you ever command a squad yourself, you'll understand the caution.
Clear Sky: Stronger Sky
Clear Sky is looking to strengthen its new position. I was told to see Arkady, Dr. Lyuger and Cygnus.
What happens next?

Well, we're still looking into our next move; I need to have a talk with Cold as to the current situation. In the meantime, why don't you ask our three new arrivals? I'm sure they've come up with something useful to do.
Clear Sky: It's Just Business
A group of bandits is harassing our supply chain from somewhere in the Red Forest. Time to put an end to them.
A group of bandits is harassing our supply chain from somewhere in the Red Forest. It's best not to escalate the situation with our allies. It might be a good idea to talk with them.
The bandit nuisance has been cleared up. I need to report back to Arkady.
Can I help you with anything?

So you're our hero, eh? I got a problem right here: bandits have sniffed out our activities in this area, they're harassing our supply chain in Red Forest. If we don't clear them out soon, we're going to be crippled up here. Sending out a whole squad doesn't work - they always see us coming. Why don't you give it a shot? Head over there, smoke them out and teach them that they never should have messed with Clear Sky.
The bandit trouble is no more.
Well done. Now the route's open and we've got our supplies coming in nicely. Here, this is for you.
Why don't you lay off the Clear Sky supply chain? My faction doesn't like seeing our friends getting ripped off.

Is that so? Ok, bro, I'm reasonable: let's not let this get in the way of a happy partnership. But you have to understand it's a long, shitty trip to come up here and we'd like to see something for it. We can make this easy: just give us, eh... twenty thousand and my boys and I will skip town. You've got my word on it. Is it a deal?
Here. Now, piss off. %c[d_orange][20000]
Hah, glad to see reasonable stalkers around here. Okay, you can tell whoever sent you that we'll steer clear of their shit.
Clear Sky: Theory Isn't Enough
I have to use the modified shotgun that Cygnus gave me to kill ten mutants.
The gun Cygnus gave me exploded to pieces when I shot. I'm sure he'll be interested to hear about it.
Cygnus' modified TOZ-34 Bizon
Have anything I can help with?

I'm sure Pilman has told you about my hobbies during my time on the Skadovsk; I picked up all sorts of interesting things regarding gunsmithing, upgrading weapons, improving equipment and the like. I brought some of my work with me, but I haven't had the chance to test anything out. Here's a special project of mine: a TOZ-34 Bizon with some... adjustments. Take it and go try it out. I want plenty of feedback, so be thorough and kill, let's say, ten mutants. Good hunting!
I think your shooter needs some more work. It exploded to shit in my hands.

Hmm... looks like those new barrels aren't sturdy enough - should have done my dispersion tests with heavier loads. Spleen was right again: you just can't go cheap on materials. Oh, and sorry about that, you alright? Here, for your trouble. I think that's all I've got for testing at the moment; I'll just be fine-tuning for a while. Come see me if you need help with your equipment.
Clear Sky: The Physician's Instruments
Lyuger needs some medical instruments. They are:
Need anything?
Ah yes, I remember you from the swamp: you did some neat work navigating anomaly fields. You actually remind me of someone I knew long ago.
Who is that?
I'm sure you've heard the name Scar? A painful name these days: it's hard not to think of the disaster... Anyway, there is indeed something I could use you for.
What would that be?

I need some tools for my trade: specialized medical instruments, you understand. As you can guess, it's not easy to procure such things in this circus. Even Hawaiian at the train station can't help me with these. However, I'm confident that someone around here has such items for sale. I would go looking myself but... my leg, you know. If you would like to assist me, here is the list of the things I need.
I managed to track down what you were looking for.
Job well done! You've come through for me again. And, as I once said, fair rewards for honest work.
Clear Sky: The Past Sky
I have agreed with Pilman to kill a group of Monolith at Dredge Station in Zaton. They are very dangerous, for they were once Clear Sky elite fighters, but Pilman promised a fine payment.
I have killed the Monolith group. They were setting up a weird device, but I had destroyed it. Looks like they were up to something suspicious. I would better report it to Pilman.
Anything new?

Just in time. I think we should start from the disaster. Maybe you don't know about it, for you have just come to the Zone lately. A couple of years ago, the Zone became unstable, for a man named Strelok tried to reach the north of the Zone. We chased him all the way to the Nuclear Power Plant, and we succeeded in stopping him. But then right at this moment, a big emission occurred causing massive casualties to us. Even worse, after that, we have found some of our men being among Monolith ranks. One of our highly skilled assault forces was reported in responsibility for countless murder cases. How shame?
I guess they are our target, aren't they?

Exactly. Also, they have many handsome bounties on their head, so you better believe. They have set up a camp at Dredge Station in Zaton reacently, and surely they won't leave anytime soon. Remember, they were Clear Sky veteran fighters and all well trained, you better use caution when approaching. There are still works to be done here, so I can't leave the base for now. You have to carry this mission alone, perhaps with your gang, I suppose. All I care about is a cure for them. You take the bounty money.
Consider it done.
Ehh... Monolith is too dangerous. I can't help with it.
They are dead. Seems they were setting up a weird device.
Device? Wait. I have a bad feeling about this. How does it look?
It is a kind of machine creating a psi field around. I have destroyed it.
Damn, exactly it... Well. Well done, friend. These are all of their bounties Arkady could collect from his... sources. Spend them wisely.
Clear Sky: Defend Clear Sky Base
An unknown monolith force is attacking us. I have to help Pilman defend the base.
The monolith force has been pushed back. Pilman want to see me.
I have run away from the conflict. It was a shame, but I have to explain to Pilman.
You seem to know what is behind it, aren't you?

Yes. Have you ever heard of the Miracle Machine in Yantar factory? We've had a research team studying the psi field around it before. We even made a small psi emitter to simulate the big one in the factory.
It would be quite dangerous, if you ask me.

Of course. Even though it didn't harm anyone, we decided to stop and destroy all documents related to it. The only person who knows how to make it is Deneb, the one who led the research team, and he was missing in the emission back in the day.
I guess Lebedev wasn't happy with that.

Sure, why would he? He disapproved, but he got the point. It was too dangerous. We decided to stop and destroy all documents related to it. The only person who knows how to make it is Deneb, the one who led the research team, and he was missing in the emission back in the day.
You mean he is among Monolith ranks and has responsibility for that psi emitter?

I'm afraid so. Great Swamp Base has been attacked by Monolith force before. Information found from their bodies via PDA said that Deneb was behind the attack. So you knew why we decided to build this base here. Research is just an excuse. We want to learn what he is after, not to mention that he has such dangerous knowledge.
Well. Then what should we...
What is this noise?
The monolith is attacking us. Where do they come from?
Everyone! We are in a situation. Stay sharp and stick together.
Don't let your guard down. Stay close and watch each others' backs.
They are more coming in. Keep it up.
Seems like they have stopped. Hey buddy, come see me. We need to talk.
Glad to see you stood with us in the fight. I was nervous to let you know about our plan, but your actions have proved yourself a trustworthy person. Men like you are hard to find these days.
You would better believe.

The assault was a surprise for us, but we managed to hold the base, and they were retreated. However, I am disappointed to hear that you fled from the field of battle. I know the fight was tough and retreating would be a better choice, but such coward behaviors won't be rewarded. It reminded me too much of the Clear Sky I once knew. I hope that you won't let me down next time.
I'm sorry. It will never happen again.
Any news?
Anything to report?
Hm?
Yes?
Good to see you.
Welcome.
Hello, friend.
What do you need?
What's up?
Huh? What is it?
Take a look.
The best weapons and armor.
Here's what I can spare.
You've come to the right place.
Welcome to my humble store.
How's it going?
Greetings, stalker.
Need to fix something?
Good day!
Hello there.
Tools, repair kits, oil...
Want to do it yourself, huh?
Don't ever think you can replace me, buddy.
I usually don't want to share them. But for you is fine.
So you are a technician, then.
My specialty.
Let me see.
Guns can solve every problem.
The finest equipments for the best stalker.
Western shooters, russian shooters, nothing I can't handle.
Yes?
Speak.
Talk.
Hm?
I'm listening.
Bandages, medkits, medicines...
See for yourself.
Use them wisely.
I don't have many of these.
Preparation is fine, but not having to use any of these would be better.
Is it a bit too much reinforcement for the base?
Perhaps. But once a situation is in, every bit of it count. More is better than not enough.
You can definitely have guns that are better than an AK-74u.

I spent most of my time to train recruits. It isn't wise to use a fancy shooter that they can't own one for themself anytime soon. Besides that, using the same weapon as they are works best for earning their trust.
TODO
TODO
What kind of business were you doing before entering the Zone?

So what is it that you are expecting? It is the same as what I'm doing right now, dealling weapons. One day, a group of bandits had enough balls to raid a supply convoy of Ukraine Military which I taked part in and held me as a hostage. Time passed long enough for me to know that there wouldn't be any rescuing from those corrupted lame troops. Eventually, Pilman and his gang attacked the bandits and found me and I found myself among Clear Sky ranks.
PKM huh? A weird weapon choice for an elegant trader, I guess.
Not that heavy comparing to a PKM sealed in a wooden box. Carrying goods everyday keeps my old age a bay. I can definitely take two lazy Military guards in a brawl.
What? You are selling toolkits?

Gotcha. Can you believe it? No a single technician in the Zone has a set of toolkits for himself but seeking stalkers around to fetch it for him. And even more than that, no a single trader bothers selling it. A good opportunity I could say.
Can I use the vise?
Feel free to use it. There is nothing to bargain with our friends. Just make sure to clean it up afterward.
Shotguns are a powerful type of firearm, indeed.

Here in the Zone, we use weapons for self-defense against mutants more than hostile stalkers. One hit will kill most of the mutants you would face. If one hit doesn't work, two hits will definitely do. But don't afraid to use more since buckshot shells are very cheap comparing to the shells of other calibers.
TODO
TODO
How is your leg?
What can I say? One less leg to worry about when hacking my way around anomalies, I suppose. You should try it sometime.
Sniper rifle? Very much expected weapon for a medic.

I prefer "doctor". It is just recently since I lost the leg. Less movement, you know. It is quite decent for scouting an area before seaching for artefacts. But sticking on high ground and snipping dogs and snorks isn't a fun experience.
Can you tell me about factions?
Yes.
Thanks for sharing the knowledge.
I want to learn more about Clear Sky.
I want to learn more about Clear Sky.
Can you tell me about anomalies?
Sure.
Thanks for sharing the knowledge.
I want to learn more about Gravity.

Springboard, Vortex, Whirligig are in this category. Though they all are gravity-based anomalies, their behavior is different. From cheap blasts of the Springboard, draging victims to the center of the Vortex to snatching victims up in the air and dismembering them to non-existing of the Whirligig. Bolts can easily spot them but they can't tell you the size.
I want to learn more about Gas.

Those acid clouds erode cells of living creatures extremely quickly. You've known why I lost my leg already. The toxic isn't much of an issue. Even a cheap cloth mask would keep you alive long enough to comfortably search for artefacts. Bolts won't help you much with this type. Better keep a keen eye on your steps as they are fairly easy to be spotted.
I want to learn more about Burner.

They are strange fire sourses, burn like hell even in rain. You can easily recognize them by the sight of structures being burned down around and the heat in the air. Tossing a bolt will definitely smoke them out. But the worst part is that the heat will destroy equipment very quickly. Impatient stalkers usually end up dead in this kind of anomaly, for they fear their expensive equipment being ruined.
I want to learn more about Electro.

They are static electricity sources, charge up like capacitors, and discharge on contact with conductive materials. The worst thing, the resistor of living creature cells is low than enough to trigger them so you would better believe. They are easily to be spotted by both eyes and bolts but they are always in clusters with each other. You won't find a Electro staying alone.
